verse: When the priest Pashhur (son of Immer, chief officer of the temple guard) heard what Jeremiah was prophesying,
he had the prophet beaten and put in the stocks at the upper Benjamin gate near the temple, a place where everyone in the city could see this painful and embarrassing spectacle.
The next morning, Pashhur released him from the stocks, hoping Jeremiah had learned his lesson. Instead, this is what he heard from the prophet:
